itemrec.name: Item Recommendation Engine
itemrec.description:
Recommend interesting items to each user personally.

Sample Use Cases

  • recommend top N items to users personally
  • predict users' future preferences
  • help users to discover new topics they may be interested in
  • personalize content
  • optimize sales

freshnessTimeUnit.name: Time Unit for Freshness
freshnessTimeUnit.description: The time unit in seconds for freshness prioritization. As an example, if you set this to one day (86400), and freshness is set to 10, items that are one day old would have their score degraded by a bit more than 60%.

numRecommendations.description: Number of recommendations to be generated for each user

dedupByAttribute.name: Dedup By Attribute
dedupByAttribute.description: When specified, the engine returns at most 1 item per custom attribute value.

paramsections.name: Recommendation Preferences
paramsections.description: You could adjust the following parameters using the sliders. Higher value means more important to your App.

subsections.name: Unseen Items Only
subsections.description: Should the system recommend items that users have seen before?

subsections.name: Seen Actions
subsections.description: Actions to be treated as seen (space-separated string, e.g. 'like rate'). If empty, all actions will be treated as seen.

subsections.name: Dedup by Custom Attribute
subsections.description: Only return at most one item per attribute value.

paramsections.name: Recommendation Goal
paramsections.description: Please define the goal to be maximized. Algorithms will be evaluated based on the goal defined here.

itemrank.name: Item Ranking Engine
itemrank.description:
Rank given items to each user personally.

Sample Use Cases

  • prioritize a set of items to users personally
  • reorder menu items to users personally

freshnessTimeUnit.name: Time Unit for Freshness
freshnessTimeUnit.description: The time unit in seconds for freshness prioritization. As an example, if you set this to one day (86400), and freshness is set to 10, items that are one day old would have their score degraded by a bit more than 60%.

paramsections.name: Recommendation Preferences
paramsections.description: You could adjust the following parameters using the sliders. Higher value means more important to your App.

itemsim.name: Item Similarity Engine
itemsim.description:
Discover similar items.

Sample Use Cases

  • predict what else would a user like if this user likes a, i.e. "People who like this also like...."
  • automatic item grouping

freshnessTimeUnit.name: Time Unit for Freshness
freshnessTimeUnit.description: The time unit in seconds for freshness prioritization. As an example, if you set this to one day (86400), and freshness is set to 10, items that are one day old would have their score degraded by a bit more than 60%.

numSimilarItems.description: Number of similar items to be generated for each item.

dedupByAttribute.name: Dedup By Attribute
dedupByAttribute.description: When specified, the engine returns at most 1 item per custom attribute value.

paramsections.name: Prediction Preferences
paramsections.description: You could adjust the following parameters using the sliders. Higher value means more important to your App.

subsections.name: Dedup by Custom Attribute
subsections.description: Only return at most one item per attribute value.

paramsections.name: Prediction Goal
paramsections.description: Please define the goal to be maximized. Algorithms will be evaluated based on the goal defined here.

pio-itemrec-single-random.name: Random Rank (Single Machine)
datareq: Users and Items.

pio-itemsim-single-random.name: Random Rank (Single Machine)
datareq: Users and Items.

pio-itemrec-distributed-random.name: Random Rank
datareq: Users and Items.

pio-itemrec-distributed-latest.name: Latest Rank
datareq: Users and Items with starttime.

pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-als.name: GraphChi's Alternating Least Squares Collaborative Filtering
pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-als.description: Predict user preferences based on matrix factorization.
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

maxIter.name: Maximum Number of Iterations
maxIter.description: Maximum number of training iterations allowed.

haltRMSEInc.name: Halt on RMSE Increase
haltRMSEInc.description: Stop execution when validation error goes up. Run at least the number of iterations specified in the flag.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-als_coord.name: GraphChi's CCD++ Alternating Least Squares Collaborative Filtering with Parallel Coordinate Descent
pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-als_coord.description: Predict user preferences based on matrix factorization.
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

maxIter.name: Maximum Number of Iterations
maxIter.description: Maximum number of training iterations allowed.

haltRMSEInc.name: Halt on RMSE Increase
haltRMSEInc.description: Stop execution when validation error goes up. Run at least the number of iterations specified in the flag.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-sgd.description: Predict user preferences based on matrix factorization.
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

maxIter.name: Maximum Number of Iterations
maxIter.description: Maximum number of training iterations allowed.

haltRMSEInc.name: Halt on RMSE Increase
haltRMSEInc.description: Stop execution when validation error goes up. Run at least the number of iterations specified in the flag.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-climf.name: GraphChi's CLiMF algorithm
pio-itemrec-single-graphchi-climf.description: Predict user preferences based on matrix factorization and optimizing MRR (mean reciprocal rank)
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

relevanceThresh.name: Binary Relevant Threshold
relevanceThresh.description: Consider the item liked/relevant if rating is at least this value.

haltMRRDec.name: Halt on MRR Decrease
haltMRRDec.description: Halt if the training set objective (smoothed MRR) decreases.

numRatings.name: Number of Ratings
numRatings.description: Consider this many top predicted items when computing actual MRR on validation set.

maxIter.name: Maximum Number of Iterations
maxIter.description: Maximum number of training iterations allowed.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-distributed-mahout-itembased.name: Mahout's Threshold Item Based Collaborative Filtering
pio-itemrec-distributed-mahout-itembased.description: Predicts user preferences based on previous behaviors of users on similar items.
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

booleanData.name: Boolean Data
booleanData.description: Treat input data as having no preference values.

maxPrefsPerUser.name: Max Num of Preferences per User
maxPrefsPerUser.description: Maximum number of preferences considered per user in final recommendation phase.

minPrefsPerUser.name: Min Num of Preferences per User
minPrefsPerUser.description: Ignore users with less preferences than this.

maxSimilaritiesPerItem.name: Max Num of Similarities per Item
maxSimilaritiesPerItem.description: Maximum number of similarities considered per item.

maxPrefsInItemSimilarity.name: Max Num of Preferences per User in Item Similarity
maxPrefsInItemSimilarity.description: Max number of preferences to consider per user in the item similarity computation phase, users with more preferences will be sampled down.

threshold.name: Threshold
threshold.description: Discard item pairs with a similarity value below this.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-distributed-mahout-parallela.name: Mahout's Parallel ALS-WR
pio-itemrec-distributed-mahout-parallela.description: Predicts user preferences based on previous behaviors of users.
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

implicitFeedback.name: Implicit Feedback
implicitFeedback.description: Whether data consists of implicit data.

alpha.name: Alpha
alpha.description: Confidence parameter will be ignored if Implicit Feedback is false.

numFeatures.name: Number of Factorized Features
numFeatures.description: Dimension of the factorized feature space.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-mahout-knnitembased.name: Mahout's kNN Item Based Collaborative Filtering (extension to GenericItemBased) (Single Machine)
pio-itemrec-single-mahout-knnitembased.description: Predicts user preferences based on previous behaviors of users on similar items (Single Machine).
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

booleanData.name: Boolean Data
booleanData.description: Treat input data as having no preference values.

weighted.name: Weighted
weighted.description: The Similarity score is weighted (only applied to Euclidean Distance, Pearson Correlation, Uncentered Cosine item similarity).

preComputeItemSim.name: Pre-Compute Item Similarity
preComputeItemSim.description: Pre-compute item similarity for better run time performance (but use more storage space and memory).

similarItemsPerItem.name: Number of Similar Items per Items
similarItemsPerItem.description: Number of Similar items in pre-computed item similarity. Only applicable when Pre-Compute Item Similarity = true. Should set this cautiously if you have large number of items (>100K). Storage space needed is about number of items * number of similar items * 30Bytes. Also, the pre-computed similarity will be loaded into memory.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-mahout-knnuserbased.name: Mahout's kNN User Based Collaborative Filtering (Single Machine)
pio-itemrec-single-mahout-knnuserbased.description: Predicts user preferences based on previous behaviors of users who are the k-nearest neighbors (Single Machine).
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

booleanData.name: Boolean Data
booleanData.description: Treat input data as having no preference values.

nearestN.name: Nearest K
nearestN.description: K-nearest neighbors to a given user.

weighted.name: Weighted
weighted.description: The Similarity score is weighted (only applied to Euclidean Distance, Pearson Correlation, Uncentered Cosine user similarity).

samplingRate.name: Sampling Rate
samplingRate.description: Must be greater > 0 and <= 1. Percentage of users to consider when building neighborhood. Decrease to trade quality for performance.

selections.name: Use the highest preference score one
Use the lowest preference score one

subsections.name: User Action Scores
subsections.description: Define the preference score represented by each user action from 1 to 5. 5 is the most preferred, 1 is the least preferred. 3 is neutral.

subsections.name: Overriding
subsections.description: When there are conflicting actions, e.g. a user gives an item a rating 5 but later dislikes it, determine which action will be considered as final preference.

pio-itemrec-single-mahout-thresholduserb.description: Predicts user preferences based on previous behaviors of users whose similarity meets or exceeds a certain threshold (Single Machine).
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions such as Like, Conversion and Rate.

booleanData.name: Boolean Data
booleanData.description: Treat input data as having no preference values.

weighted.name: Weighted
weighted.description: The Similarity score is weighted (only applied to Euclidean Distance, Pearson Correlation, Uncentered Cosine user similarity).

samplingRate.name: Sampling Rate

numFeatures.name: Number of Factorized Features

learningRateDecay.name: Learning Rate Decay
learningRateDecay.description: Multiplicative decay factor for Learning Rate.

pio-itemrec-single-featurebased_batch.name: Feature Based, Batch Mode. (Experimental)
pio-itemrec-single-featurebased_batch.description: Item recommendation based on item's feature vector (itypes). This engine build a user preference model based on high ratings items (rate > 3).
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions.

featureItypes.name: Feature Itypes
featureItypes.description: A comma-delimited list of itypes that is used to construct the preference model. If not specified, all itypes found in items will be used.

pio-itemrec-single-featurebased_realtime.name: Feature Based, Realtime Mode. (Experimental)
pio-itemrec-single-featurebased_realtime.description: Item recommendation based on item's feature vector (itypes). This engine build a user preference model based on high ratings items (rate > 3).
datareq: Users, Items, and U2I Actions.

featureItypes.name: Feature Itypes
featureItypes.description: A comma-delimited list of itypes that is used to construct the preference model. If not specified, all itypes found in items will be used.

pio-itemsim-distributed-random.name: Random Rank
datareq: Items.

pio-itemsim-distributed-latest.name: Latest Rank
pio-itemsim-distributed-latest.description: Consider latest items as most similar.
datareq: Items with starttime.

pio-distributed-trainingtestsplit.name: Training/Test Data Splitter With Time Order Option
pio-distributed-trainingtestsplit.description: Split data into training, validation and test sets

timeorder.name: Data Selection
timeorder.description: Random with Time Order means that data in Test Set is always newer than those in Train Set.

pio-single-trainingtestsplit.name: Training and Test Set Data Splitter for User-to-Item Actions (Single Machine)
pio-single-trainingtestsplit.description: Split data into training, validation and test sets

timeorder.name: Data Selection
